    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When the user is dragging a tab that was initially in a group, an extension can mark the tab as pinned. If the drag is then cancelled, the tab will be moved back into its original group, resulting in a tab that's both pinned and in a group. Moving the group to a different index will then also move the pinned tab. This then breaks the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Finally, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->When the user is dragging a tab that was initially in a group, an extension can mark the tab as pinned. If the drag is then cancelled, the tab will be moved back into its original group, resulting in a tab that's both pinned and in a group. Moving the group to a different index will then also move the pinned tab. This then breaks the constraint that pinned tabs are always at the start of the tab strip. Finally, attempting to move the pinned tab to a different index will result in an out-of-bounds write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4477.0 (latest asan build)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Tested on 92.0.4477.0 (latest asan build)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10, version 20H2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Install the attached extension.<span class="line"><!---->1. Install the attached extension.<!----></span><br>2. Move a tab into a new group, then start dragging the tab within its tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->2. Move a tab into a new group, then start dragging the tab within its tab strip.<!----></span><br>3. Once the extension detects that a tab has been moved (using chrome.tabs.onMoved), the extension will mark the tab as pinned and navigate it.<span class="line"><!---->3. Once the extension detects that a tab has been moved (using chrome.tabs.onMoved), the extension will mark the tab as pinned and navigate it.<!----></span><br>On Windows, the tab will be navigated to "<span class="line"><!---->On Windows, the tab will be navigated to "<!----></span>mailto:<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:"><!---->mailto:<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span> This will cause the drag to be cancelled, at least on Windows 10, when the application chooser dialog is shown.<span class="line"><!----> This will cause the drag to be cancelled, at least on Windows 10, when the application chooser dialog is shown.<!----></span><br>On other platforms, the tab will be navigated to about:blank (simply to make it easy to tell when the drag should be cancelled) and you'll need to manually cancel the drag by pressing ESC.<span class="line"><!---->On other platforms, the tab will be navigated to about:blank (simply to make it easy to tell when the drag should be cancelled) and you'll need to manually cancel the drag by pressing ESC.<!----></span><br>The updated tab will now be both pinned and in a group.<span class="line"><!---->The updated tab will now be both pinned and in a group.<!----></span><br>4. Five seconds later, the extension will call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to index 1. This will move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<span class="line"><!---->4. Five seconds later, the extension will call chrome.tabGroups.move to move the group to index 1. This will move the pinned tab, meaning that there's now a pinned tab that's not at the start of the tab strip.<!----></span><br>5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<span class="line"><!---->5. Finally, the extension will use chrome.tabs.move to move the pinned tab to index 0. This will result in an OOB write in the browser process.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: David Erceg<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: David Erceg<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ultimately, the end result of this issue is similar to the result described in <span class="line"><!---->Ultimately, the end result of this issue is similar to the result described in <!----></span>issue 1196309<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1196309" title="Security: OOB vector insertion when extension highlights tab during drag"><!---->issue 1196309<!----></a>. However. the core problem here is that when a drag is cancelled, the group of each dragged tab is restored, regardless of whether or not any of the tabs have been pinned. That's something that's done at the end of TabDragController::RevertDragAt:<span class="line"><!---->. However. the core problem here is that when a drag is cancelled, the group of each dragged tab is restored, regardless of whether or not any of the tabs have been pinned. That's something that's done at the end of TabDragController::RevertDragAt:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_drag_controller.cc;l=1742;drc=a9cc926063ef9fad68351d9c24d7e26b00c634c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_drag_controller.cc;l=1742;drc=a9cc926063ef9fad68351d9c24d7e26b00c634c7"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/tabs/tab_drag_controller.cc;l=1742;drc=a9cc926063ef9fad68351d9c24d7e26b00c634c7<!----></a><br><br>In this case, the to_position value passed to TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl is -1 and the element is written just before the start of the contents_data_ vector.<span class="line"><!---->In this case, the to_position value passed to TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl is -1 and the element is written just before the start of the contents_data_ vector.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1198717#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1198717#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, May 12, 2021, 2:21 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        We decided to prevent the extensions code from modifying the tab strip while a tab drag was in progress to prevent these security issues. (Another CL: <span class="line"><!---->We decided to prevent the extensions code from modifying the tab strip while a tab drag was in progress to prevent these security issues. (Another CL: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2891080<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2891080"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2891080<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>Can we add (or have we already added) some validation to the tab strip code as well to ensure clients don't modify the tab strip while a tab drag is in progress? Said differently, even if the extensions code tries to modify the tab strip during a tab drag, it shouldn't result in an out-of-bounds and the tab strip code should handle it gracefully (either the operation should be a no-op or result in a DCHECK failure I think, with the former preferred IMO).<span class="line"><!---->Can we add (or have we already added) some validation to the tab strip code as well to ensure clients don't modify the tab strip while a tab drag is in progress? Said differently, even if the extensions code tries to modify the tab strip during a tab drag, it shouldn't result in an out-of-bounds and the tab strip code should handle it gracefully (either the operation should be a no-op or result in a DCHECK failure I think, with the former preferred IMO).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         Approving merge to M91. Please merge to branch 4472.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <tbody>

        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        for LitElement.

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);
<script type="module" nonce="">
// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);
</script>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
